publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-2152# Helen Eadie: Edinburgh Airport Developments Welcomed—That the Parliament welcomes the excellent opportunities for new developments such as the growth of Edinburgh Airport combined with the fact that existing on-site businesses may require to relocate to new sites away from the airport; welcomes the opportunity that this will present for former coal mining communities outside Edinburgh to bid to attract businesses, such as those at Ingliston, to their locality with the added benefit that such developments will present new employment opportunities for those communities in greatest need of regeneration, and recognises that a number of such communities are well-situated with good access to motorway and transport networks.

S2M-2152# Helen Eadie: Edinburgh Airport Developments Welcomed—That the Parliament welcomes the excellent opportunities for new developments such as the growth of Edinburgh Airport combined with the fact that existing on-site businesses may require to relocate to new sites away from the airport; welcomes the opportunity that this will present for former coal mining communities outside Edinburgh to bid to attract businesses, such as those at Ingliston, to their locality with the added benefit that such developments will present new employment opportunities for those communities in greatest need of regeneration, and recognises that a number of such communities are well-situated with good access to motorway and transport networks. Supported by: Christine May*
S2M-2152# Edinburgh Airport Developments Welcomed (lodged on 13 December 2004) Marilyn Livingstone*
